availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Assistant Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 1 ; 5 Sept 1863 - 2 Feb 1864

body.p: Col. W. B. Craddock will proceed to Mt Sterling the Camp of the 40" Ky Infantry and take charge of the Recruits mentioned in the annexed Muster Roll, and bring them to Frankfort, said Recruits will form a part of the 30" Regiment.

On examination of the United States Muster Rolls, of the 40th Regiment ten full companies have been mustered you wil therefore notify Col. C. J. True, that he cannot recruit any more men for his Regiment without authority from these Head Quarters.

By order of the Governor
John Boyle
Adj't Genl of Ky.
